intro: Zaluzianskia macrocarpa, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant is an annual herb with hairy, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name. Zaluzianskia macrocarpa is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
